channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Shocks, Crises, and False Alarms
item.description: Carlsson-Szlezak and Swartz attempt to add fresh thinking on framing macro shocks that may often prove to be false alarms. Any general reader will obtain some key fresh insights with this work, and CFA charterholders will be offered an alternative to the conventional Wall Street approach to macro discussions.

item.title: Junk bonds are now in high demand as Wall Street bets on another Trump presidency
item.description: “US high yield is the trade. It is more domestic-focused and exposed to US economic activity.”

item.title: Preserving the Dollar: The Role of CBDCs in Securing Economic Stability for Future Generations
item.description: As financial systems evolve, preserving the US dollar's dominance will require skillful policy management and the integration of cutting-edge technologies.

item.title: The worst IT catastrophe ever hit less than 1% of all Microsoft Windows devices
item.description: A faulty software update from cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike affected 8.5 million devices globally that rely on the Microsoft Windows operating system.

item.title: Can Equal Weight Solve Our Concentration Crisis? Not So Fast…
item.description: Mega-cap concentration has exploded since 2015. The corollary to an increasingly top-heavy benchmark is that market diversification and breadth have never been more limited. A multifactor methodology can be a restorative balance to US equities when more traditional measures fall short.

item.title: Phishing attempts rise as scam artists try to exploit the CrowdStrike global tech outage
item.description: “We know that adversaries and bad actors will try to exploit events like this,” CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz said.

item.title: In Search of the Elusive Neutral Interest Rate
item.description: With Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's semiannual address to the Senate Banking Committee this week fresh in mind, it is an ideal time to consider the drivers of r*.

item.title: Gunman in Trump assassination attempt flew a drone over the rally site ahead of shooting, official says
item.description: More details about the investigation are expected to be made public in the coming week when FBI Director Chris Wray appears before the House Judiciary Committee.

item.title: Commodities for the Long Run?
item.description: Asset classes such as commodities have historically had notable diversification benefits for longer-term investors who are concerned with inflation.

item.title: ‘Black Swan’ investor warns the ‘greatest bubble in human history’ is about to pop and stocks could lose more than half their value
item.description: The federal government will have less capacity to respond, and the economy could enter a recession by the end of this year, Mark Spitznagel predicted.
